availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
The State of Kentucky
County of Jefferson

This day C, FW. Tiller made oath before me that on or about the 5th day of November 1865 a felony was committed in the City of Louisville Jefferson County and state of Kentucky by the felonious stealing and taking away two horses and one wagon the property of Traugott Krachrugge of said City, That said horses and wagon were worth $200,00

That affiant has good grounds to beleive that one Louis Henry committed said felony and that he is now a fugitive from Justice confined in the Jail of Dubois County (at Jaspe Jasper) in the state of Indiana (where he has been arrested on said charge and the horses and wagon recovered) and now awaits requisition)
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 122d day of November 1865
Jos Clement. J P J C
Please make out the requisition and forward it to C W Tiller Louisville Ky

Requisition upon Gov Indiana
for Louis Henry & C. W. Tiller apptd Agent
25 Nov/65
